data.text: The Lord created man of the earth,
He gave them few days, and a short time,
He endued them with strength by themselves,
And put the fear of man upon all flesh,
Counsel, and a tongue, and eyes,
Withal he filled them with the knowledge of understanding,
He set his eye upon their hearts,
And they shall praise his holy name,
Beside this he gave them knowledge,
He made an everlasting covenant with them,
Their eyes saw the majesty of his glory,
And he said unto them,
Their ways are ever before him,
For in the division of the nations of the whole earth
Therefore all their works are as the sun before him,
None of their unrighteous deeds are hidden from him,
The alms of a man is as a signet with him,
Afterward he will rise up and reward them,
But unto them that repent, he granted them return,
Return unto the Lord, and forsake thy sins,
Turn again to the most High, and turn away from iniquity:
Who shall praise the most High in the grave,
Thanksgiving perisheth from the dead, as from one that is not:
How great is the lovingkindness of the Lord our God,
For all things cannot be in men,
What is brighter than the sun? yet the light thereof faileth:
He vieweth the power of the height of heaven;
